New Records: Mikel Merino scored a goal in the 119th minute to give Spain a 2-1 win over Germany in an enthralling Euro 2024 quarterfinal clash.
Key Match Events: Mikel Merino scored the winning goal for Spain in the 119th minute
Florian Wirtz equalized for Germany in the 89th minute
Dani Olmo gave Spain a deserved lead six minutes after the break
Dani Carvajal was sent off after receiving a second yellow card for tackling Jamal Musiala
Pre-Game Insights: No pre-game insights mentioned in the article
Post-Match Reflections: Olmo said after the match: 'The heart is always more important than the legs.'
Merino said: 'The adrenaline is taking its toll on me now.'
Merino said: 'It's been a unique moment.'
Merino said: 'There's a lot of work behind it, especially from my teammates, who were doing a great job.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played at the MHPArena in Stuttgart, Germany, in front of a majority of German fans.
The match was an enthralling Euro 2024 quarterfinal clash between the tournament's two most successful nations.
Others: Germany coach Julian Nagelsmann made five substitutions in a desperate attempt to find the equaliser.
